info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 30 at 5:57PM EDT until March 30 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, Pinecrest, Sunset, Glenvar Heights, Olympia Heights, University Of Miami, Richmond Heights, The Crossings, Westchester, Coral Terrace, The Falls, Howard, Coral Way Village, Palmetto Estates and Three Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING
